Let (Pi,j⊆[n]×[n])i,j∈[k]×[k]subscriptsubscript𝑃𝑖𝑗delimited-[]𝑛delimited-[]𝑛𝑖𝑗delimited-[]𝑘delimited-[]𝑘(P_{i,j}\subseteq[n]\times[n])_{i,j\in[k]\times[k]} be the instance of Grid Tiling.

For each (i,j)𝑖𝑗(i,j), we add a biclique Kt,q−9​(i,j):=Kt,q−9assignsubscript𝐾𝑡𝑞9𝑖𝑗subscript𝐾𝑡𝑞9K_{t,q-9}(i,j):=K_{t,q-9}, where q:=14​k2assign𝑞14superscript𝑘2q:=14k^{2}.
The part of Kt,q−9​(i,j)subscript𝐾𝑡𝑞9𝑖𝑗K_{t,q-9}(i,j) with size t𝑡t is denoted by Ai,jsubscript𝐴𝑖𝑗A_{i,j} and the other part by Bi,jsubscript𝐵𝑖𝑗B_{i,j} (see Figure 4).
We denote by Ai,jsubscript𝐴𝑖𝑗A_{i,j} the t𝑡t vertices to the left of Kt,q−9​(i,j)subscript𝐾𝑡𝑞9𝑖𝑗K_{t,q-9}(i,j) on Figure 4, and by Bi,jsubscript𝐵𝑖𝑗B_{i,j}, the q−9𝑞9q-9 vertices to the right.
The vertices of Ai,jsubscript𝐴𝑖𝑗A_{i,j} are in one-to-one correspondence with the pairs of Pi,jsubscript𝑃𝑖𝑗P_{i,j}.
We denote by ai,j​(x,y)∈Ai,jsubscript𝑎𝑖𝑗𝑥𝑦subscript𝐴𝑖𝑗a_{i,j}(x,y)\in A_{i,j} the vertex corresponding to (x,y)∈Pi,j𝑥𝑦subscript𝑃𝑖𝑗(x,y)\in P_{i,j}.
We make the construction “cyclic”, or rather “toroidal”.
So in what follows, every occurrence of i+1𝑖1i+1 or j+1𝑗1j+1 should be interpreted as 1 in case i=k𝑖𝑘i=k or j=k𝑗𝑘j=k. Every vertex in a half-graph H​(i→i+1,j)𝐻→𝑖𝑖1𝑗H(i\rightarrow i+1,j) or H​(i,j→j+1)𝐻→𝑖𝑗𝑗1H(i,j\rightarrow j+1) is made adjacent to its corresponding vertex in Ai,j∪Ai+1,j∪Ai,j+1subscript𝐴𝑖𝑗subscript𝐴𝑖1𝑗subscript𝐴𝑖𝑗1A_{i,j}\cup A_{i+1,j}\cup A_{i,j+1}.
Thus ai,j​(x,y)subscript𝑎𝑖𝑗𝑥𝑦a_{i,j}(x,y) is linked to hi¯→i+1,j​(x,y)subscriptℎ→¯𝑖𝑖1𝑗𝑥𝑦h_{\underline{i}\rightarrow i+1,j}(x,y), hi−1→i¯,j​(x,y)subscriptℎ→𝑖1¯𝑖𝑗𝑥𝑦h_{i-1\rightarrow\underline{i},j}(x,y), hi,j¯→j+1​(x,y)subscriptℎ→𝑖¯𝑗𝑗1𝑥𝑦h_{i,\underline{j}\rightarrow j+1}(x,y), and hi,j−1→j¯​(x,y)subscriptℎ→𝑖𝑗1¯𝑗𝑥𝑦h_{i,j-1\rightarrow\underline{j}}(x,y).

This is just to prevent that one uses a vertex of a Bi,jsubscript𝐵𝑖𝑗B_{i,j} or of a half-graph as a center.
As we will see, intended solutions have all their centers in C∪⋃i,j∈[k]Ai,j𝐶subscript𝑖𝑗delimited-[]𝑘subscript𝐴𝑖𝑗C\cup\bigcup_{i,j\in[k]}A_{i,j}. This ends our polytime construction.
We denote by G𝐺G the obtained graph.
We ask for a b𝑏b-chromatic core achieving color q𝑞q.
This polytime construction is of polynomial size in the k𝑘k-by-k𝑘k Grid Tiling-instance, and q𝑞q is a computable function of k𝑘k.
We thus only need to show that the reduction is correct.
